title: Long-Term ICT-Utilized Instructional Design Competency Enhancement Program for Higher Education Mathematics Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge (mathematical theory and pedagogy) and extensive practical experience (digital tool-integrated lesson design)
context.additional_context: Emphasizes integrating ICT tools (graphing calculators, dynamic geometry software) into mathematics education and developing reflective, flexible teaching strategies (mathematical modeling, data analysis activities) for virtual/in-person classes.

learning_goals: Learners can produce digital math education content (equation visualization, function graph analysis) using instructional design documents for each stage of the ADDIE model.
Develop ≥3 interactive digital resources (RDI) applying DUA conditions (topics: geometric proofs, statistical analysis, calculus applications).
Implement ≥5 learner engagement strategies using ICT tools in blended learning environments (graph-based problem solving, simulation-based concept exploration).

Within a 6-month course, learners complete two project-based math lesson designs (topics: multivariable function modeling, probability distribution simulation) using ICT tools (GeoGebra, Desmos), submit a report including a 15+ minute classroom implementation video and learner feedback survey results (response rate ≥80%), and achieve ≥4 points in ≥3 of 4 evaluation rubric areas (content design, technology integration, lesson execution, assessment system) on a 5-point scale.

resources: ICT educational tools package (GeoGebra, Desmos, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
